attributes.action: Give Driving Instructors, lorry drivers and key workers a discount on fuel.
attributes.additional_details: Driving instructors, lorry drivers and our key workers are the people who are having to fill up their vehicles twice, maybe even three times a week in order to work/get to work. The cost of a full tank for most small cars (1 or 2 litre engines) at the moment is around £60-£70, AT LEAST, which is the average amount for petrol cars, which is the cheaper option of the two fuels, so you can only imagine what a full tank of diesel would cost, especially on vehicles with bigger engines.
attributes.background: A discount for those who need the fuel to work. For example, a discount card which is presented at the pay point, with the vehicles registration number and/or company name, along with the drivers details. By doing this means the card can only be used by the owner of the working vehicle.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the price of fuel - including any discounts offered - are a matter for retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282
